heroSection.title: Bible Translation Training
heroSection.description: Equipping local communities with the skills and knowledge needed to translate God's Word into their heart languages.

overviewSection.description: At the heart of our mission is the belief that every language community deserves access to God’s Word in their mother tongue. Our Bible Translation Training program is designed to equip local believers with the skills, tools, and spiritual foundation necessary to translate the Scriptures with accuracy dan clarity.

trainingProgramsSection.whyDescripton: Millions of people still do not have access to the full Bible in their own language. This training program empowers communities to take ownership of Bible translation efforts, ensuring that translations are:
trainingProgramsSection.whyPoints3: Naturally expressed in the local language
trainingProgramsSection.whoPoints1: Church leaders and people with a calling to Bible translation
trainingProgramsSection.whoPoints2: Local believers fluent in their mother tongue and Indonesian
trainingProgramsSection.whoPoints3: Those with a passion for language development and Scripture engagement
trainingProgramsSection.whoFootnote: No prior translation experience is needed—just a heart to serve and willingness to learn.
trainingProgramsSection.whatTitle: What is The Outcomes After Training ?
trainingProgramsSection.whatDescripton: By the end of the training, participants will be able to:
trainingProgramsSection.whatPoints1: Understand key concepts in Bible translation
trainingProgramsSection.whatPoints2: Begin drafting Scripture in their heart language
trainingProgramsSection.whatPoints4: Collaborate in a translation team under the guidance of the leader

trainingProcessSection.title: 8 Steps of MAST
trainingProcessSection.subtitle: The 8 steps of MAST (Mobilized Assistance Supporting Translation) can be used to draft Scripture into either a written or an audio format, then carefully check it.
trainingProcessSection.step1Subtitle: Read or listen to the entire chapter, aiming to grasp its meaning and main point.
trainingProcessSection.step2Subtitle: In this step, verbally summarize the main people, events, and ideas of a chapter in your native language.
trainingProcessSection.step3Subtitle: Chunking involves dividing a chapter of Scripture into smaller, easily memorable parts.
trainingProcessSection.step4Subtitle: Read or listen to the first chunk of your chapter. Without referencing the source material.
trainingProcessSection.step5Subtitle: Look at (or listen to) the source text again and compare it to what you have written (or recorded).
trainingProcessSection.step6Subtitle: Ask a team member to carefully review your blind draft translation.
trainingProcessSection.step7Subtitle: First, you and a partner must identify key words and important concepts in each verse of the source text.
trainingProcessSection.step8Subtitle: Two additional individuals, apart from the translator, are involved. These partners should be proficient in both the mother tongue and source language.

overviewSection.title: What Is Open Bible Education?
overviewSection.description1: At Bahtraku, we believe every believer—especially those in underserved, remote, or indigenous communities—should have access to solid, biblical education, regardless of location, background, or financial status.
overviewSection.description2: Open Bible Education is a non-formal biblical training program that provides free, quality theological education using Thirdmill Institute's globally recognized curriculum. This program is designed to equip church leaders, pastors, Bible teachers and every believers who may not have the opportunity to attend formal seminaries.
overviewSection.description3: Through our partnership with Thirdmill Institute, we offer a clear path for spiritual growth, theological depth, and ministry readiness for communities across Indonesia and beyond.
overviewSection.cardDescription: Thirdmill Institute is a ministry committed to providing free, seminary level biblical education to the world.
